statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fresno State 71, SMU 70
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. (AP) -- Ja'Vance Coleman made an off-balance eight-foot jumper with three seconds left, giving Fresno State a 71-70 victory over Southern Methodist on Saturday night. With the clock winding down, Coleman drove the right side of the lane, made a double-pump move on Derrick Roberts in mid-air and got the ball to roll in off the rim. Coleman scored 18 points for Fresno State (13-7, 7-4 Western Athletic Conference), which erased a 15-point first-half deficit. Patrick Simpson scored 20 points for SMU (9-10, 4-7), and Bryan Hopkins shook off an injured wrist to finish with 13 points, eight assists and seven rebounds. SMU had a good look at the buzzer, but Roberts' attempted layup over 6-foot-9 Mustafa Al-Sayyad, the WAC's leading shot-blocker, overshot the rim. Donovan Morris added 14 points for Fresno State, including four 3-pointers, and Chris Berry had 13. Devon Pearson and Eric Castro had 12 points each for SMU, which led for most of the game. The Bulldogs trailed until Dreike Bouldin's 3-pointer with 10:38 remaining tied the score at 54. Castro then scored six straight points for SMU, and Justin Isham hit a floating 15-foot jumper with 1:39 left to put the Mustangs ahead 69-63. That's when Coleman took over. The sophomore scored on Fresno State's final three possessions, including a 3-pointer with 56.9 seconds left that brought the Bulldogs within a point. SMU led by as many as 14 points in the first half before Fresno State closed with a 9-2 run to trail 41-34 at halftime. Simpson had 14 points on 5-of-7 shooting.
